dt: {bc}a series of usually metal links or rings connected to or fitted into one another and used for various purposes (such as support, restraint, transmission of mechanical power, or measurement)
{bc}a series of links used or worn as an ornament or insignia
{bc}a measuring instrument of 100 links used in surveying
{bc}a unit of length equal to 66 feet (about 20 meters)
{bc}a series of things linked, connected, or associated together
{bc}a group of enterprises or institutions of the same kind or function usually under a single ownership, management, or control
{bc}a number of atoms or chemical groups united like links in a chain

et: Middle English {it}cheyne{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}chaene{/it}, from Latin {it}catena{/it}
shortdef: a series of usually metal links or rings connected to or fitted into one another and used for various purposes (such as support, restraint, transmission of mechanical power, or measurement)
a series of links used or worn as an ornament or insignia
a measuring instrument of 100 links used in surveying

dt: {bc}to obstruct or protect by a chain
{bc}to fasten, bind, or connect with or as if with a chain

shortdef: to obstruct or protect by a chain
to fasten, bind, or connect with or as if with a chain; also : fetter

dt: {bc}a group of people (such as convicts) chained together especially as an outside working party

shortdef: a group of people (such as convicts) chained together especially as an outside working party

dt: {bc}a letter sent to several persons with a request that each send copies of the letter to an equal number of persons

shortdef: a letter sent to several persons with a request that each send copies of the letter to an equal number of persons

dt: {bc}a fence of heavy steel wire woven to form a diamond-shaped mesh

shortdef: a fence of heavy steel wire woven to form a diamond-shaped mesh
flexible armor of interlinked metal rings

dt: {bc}a series of executive positions in order of authority

shortdef: a series of executive positions in order of authority

dt: {bc}a large greenish-black pickerel ({it}Esox niger{/it}) with dark markings along the sides that is common in quiet waters of eastern North America

et: from the markings resembling chains on the sides
shortdef: a large greenish-black pickerel (Esox niger) with dark markings along the sides that is common in quiet waters of eastern North America

dt: {bc}a series of events so related to each other that each one initiates the next
{bc}a number of events triggered by the same initial event
{bc}a self-sustaining chemical or nuclear reaction yielding energy or products that cause further reactions of the same kind

shortdef: a series of events so related to each other that each one initiates the next
a number of events triggered by the same initial event
a self-sustaining chemical or nuclear reaction yielding energy or products that cause further reactions of the same kind
